intro: Clidemia oligochaeta, commonly known as the silverleaf or whiteleaf shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with a silvery or white underside. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Clidemia oligochaeta is also known for its ability to form dense thickets, which can impact local ecosystems.
